              (Modern Love, Thank U Records)
label: Re-Mastered Reissue
description: 22nd anniversary reissue of what is for us one of the greatest albums of the late 20th century, originally released on Rephlex in 1998, now painstakingly remastered by Rashad Becker after being unavailable on any format for more or less two decades. If you’re into anything from Prince to A Guy Called Gerald, Tirzah to Jai Paul, Autechre to Rick Rubin - this really is an... more

title_full:
Pretty Sneaky

              —
              Pretty Sneaky LP
            
              (Mana Records)
label: Mana Records
description:
This lot have released 5 x 12”s anonymously over the last 3 years via Hardwax and there’s no info about them anywhere, pretty sneaky.

They now land on Mana, a label so esoteric it has a flowchart on its website showing you how to get from Luc Ferrari to Nico Jaar in one short leap.

There are 4 long tracks, one per side, each clocking in at 15 mins and each... more

Bunita Marcus is subject of a first vinyl release with her ‘Lecture For Jo Kondo’, written for Morton’s group, Feldman & Soloists and premiered in 1985, and now accompanied by a dramatic new David August deconstruction .

label: XL Recordings
description:
A centrepiece of ‘Anima’ remixed by Thom Yorke and Nigel Godrich, plus Equiknoxx, Mark Pritchard, and Clark.

The icy electroid dancehall rhythm of Thom Yorke's  original ‘Not The News’ supplies wickedly chewy tackle for the remixers, prompting Equiknoxx’s Time Cow and Gavsborg to step up in killer style with a sort of 2.1-step dancehall take turning... more

artist: Lil Toby, Felix Hall, Mother, Jon K, Ntn & Ssabae

Lil Toby, Felix Hall, Mother, Jon K, Ntn & Ssabae

              —

label: Few Crackles
description:
The elusive Few Crackles lot deliver a lux box set featuring a mad lineup of mixtape selectors; Felix Hall, Jon K, Mother, Ntn & Ssabae and Lil Toby (compiler of the seminal Now Thing comp on Mo Wax). Each of them has a full tape side, (Jon K has two), trust that the selections are wild, weird and deadly.

Apart from their soundsystem parties in Paris over the last... more

label: Mainframe Audio
description:
London’s Two Shell deliver a pair of proper UK flohrwurms on their Mainframe Audio following a class debut for Livity Sound last year.

Where their first 12” sounded a lot like Latinate broken beats from late ‘90s West London, this one moves to a sort of UKF/UKB schematic recalling the late ’00s styles of Joy Orbison and Roska. 

Up top ’N35’ shakes up a percolated... more

description: Maria Rossi aka Cucina Povera follows-up a clutch of pearls for Night School with her debut for Editions Mego, a first collaborative album recorded with Edward Simpson, aka ELS, who wraps Maria's voice around growling and occasionally catchy modular electronics. Fear not, there’s no noodling inside - head straight for 'Marmori' for a properly blue take... more
